pullrequest.title: Scan and dock scoring plugin - Part3

content.raw:
Thanks Brian. I implemented most of your suggestions in [0359b2f](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/0359b2fb2f5bf27f3ccc40d6d48f5cd3e8b4c483?at=default). A few comments:

* The number of extra points are now passed as plugin parameters.
* The docking task is considered finished when the vehicle undocks after docking.
* The elapsed task time is already captured in the `scoring_plugin`. I think there’s no need to add it here.
* I didn’t grant any points for just submitting a color sequence, as I think there’s no much value on it.
* There are now points granted for docking \(in any case\) and extra points granted if the bay was the expected one.
* The idea of splitting this plugin into two plugins \(one for scoring the color sequence and one for scoring the docking\) is clean but the problem is that we designed the `scoring_plugin` in a way that we expect only one instance of it running. Otherwise, both plugins will keep track of time, scoring, publish messages and sounds more complicated. That’s the reason for making this plugin a bit more thick but at least it’s consistent with the structure of the other scoring plugins.
content.html:
Thanks Brian. I implemented most of your suggestions in 0359b2f. A few comments:

  • The number of extra points are now passed as plugin parameters.
  • The docking task is considered finished when the vehicle undocks after docking.
  • The elapsed task time is already captured in the scoring_plugin. I think there’s no need to add it here.
  • I didn’t grant any points for just submitting a color sequence, as I think there’s no much value on it.
  • There are now points granted for docking (in any case) and extra points granted if the bay was the expected one.
  • The idea of splitting this plugin into two plugins (one for scoring the color sequence and one for scoring the docking) is clean but the problem is that we designed the scoring_plugin in a way that we expect only one instance of it running. Otherwise, both plugins will keep track of time, scoring, publish messages and sounds more complicated. That’s the reason for making this plugin a bit more thick but at least it’s consistent with the structure of the other scoring plugins.
